ul.li1: 1Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:
2To know wisdom and instruction,
ul.li2: to understand sayings of understanding,
ul.li1: 3to gain insightful instruction,Literally “the instruction of insight”
ul.li2: righteousness and justice and equity,
ul.li1: 4to give shrewdnessOr “cleverness,” or “prudence” to the simple,
ul.li2: knowledge and purposeOr “plan” to the young,
ul.li1: 5may the wise hear and increase learning,
ul.li2: and the one who understands gain direction,Or “guidance”
ul.li1: 6to understand a proverb and an expression,
ul.li2: words of wisdom and their riddles.
ul.li1: 7Fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge;
ul.li2: wisdom and instruction, fools despise.

ul.li1: 8My child, may you keepOr “obey,” or “hear” your father’s instruction,
ul.li2: and do not reject your mother’s teachings,
ul.li1: 9for they are a garland of favor for your head,
ul.li2: and pendants for your neck.
ul.li1: 10My child, if sinners entice you, do not consent.
11If they say,
ul.li2: “Come with us!
We shall lie in wait for blood;
we shall ambush the innocent without cause.Or “wantonly,” or “for nothing”
ul.li1: 12Like Sheol,A term for the place where the dead reside, i.e., the Underworld we will swallow them alive
ul.li2: and whole, like those who descend to the pit.Literally “like the descenders of a pit”
ul.li1: 13We shall find all precious wealth,
ul.li2: we shall fill our houses with booty,
ul.li1: 14you shall throw your lot in our midst,
ul.li2: there will be one purse for all of us.”
ul.li1: 15My child, do not walk in their way.Or “on their road”
ul.li2: Keep your foot from their paths,
ul.li1: 16for their feet run to evil,
ul.li2: and they hurry to shed blood,
ul.li1: 17for “in vainOr “without cause,” or “for nothing” is the net scattered,
ul.li2: in the sight of any winged bird.”Literally “bird of wing”
ul.li1: 18They lie in wait for their own blood.
ul.li2: They ambush their own lives.
ul.li1: 19Thus are the ways of all who are greedy for gain—
ul.li2: it will take the life of its possessors.

ul.li1: 20Wisdom calls out in the streets,
ul.li2: in the squares she raises her voice.
ul.li1: 21On a busy cornerLiterally “head of commotion,” or “head of stirring, bustling” she cries out,
ul.li2: at the entrances of the gates in the city, she speaks her sayings:
ul.li1: 22“How long,Literally “Until when” O simple ones, will you love simplicity?
ul.li2: And how long will scoffers delight in their scoffing,
and fools hate knowledge?
ul.li1: 23May you turn to my argument!Or “turn at my reproach”
ul.li2: Behold, I shall pour out my spirit upon you;
I will make my words known to you.
ul.li1: 24Because I called out and you refused me,
ul.li2: I stretched out my hand, yet there is none who heeds.
ul.li1: 25You have ignored all my counsel,
ul.li2: and my reproof you are not willing to accept.
ul.li1: 26I will also laugh at your calamity;Or “downfall”
ul.li2: I will mock when panicOr “dread, fear” comes upon you.
ul.li1: 27When your panic comes like a storm,
ul.li2: and your calamity arrives like a whirlwind,
when distress and anguish come upon you,
ul.li1: 28then they will callOr “cry out to” me, but I will not answer;
ul.li2: they will seek me diligently but not find me.
ul.li1: 29Since they hated knowledge,
ul.li2: and did not choose the fear of Yahweh,
ul.li1: 30they were not willing to accept my counsel,
ul.li2: they despised all my reproof.
ul.li1: 31They shall eat from the fruit of their way,
ul.li2: and they shall be sated from their own schemes,
ul.li1: 32for the waywardness of the simple ones will kill them,
ul.li2: and the complacency of fools will destroy them.
ul.li1: 33Whoever listens to me will dwell in security
ul.li2: and rest securelyOr “be at ease, peace” from dread and disaster.”
